reviewText: Right off the bat, For ROH fans: This DVD = No stars.. For fans who hate garbage wresting = 1 star.This is a pretty good DVD. It only runs about 60 min, and only has 3 complete matches!!??.. but it does what it's goal was, which is to shock the viewers with the insane amount of damage these guys do to each other.. WARNING: This stuff is VERY graphic. Were not talking about WWF wrestlers hitting each other with tin pans deathmathes.. Were talking about matches were these people their health and lives on the line by doing stuff that might kill them...1. Sick Nick Mondo Vs. Mad Man Pondo Vs. The Wifebeater. (Breakaway Brawl 2001) - This is a 3-way match for the vacant CZW Iron-man Championship. It starts in a regular ring but lightbulbs, glass, and other crazy crap quickly gets involved. Unbelivably, this is the most tame match on the DVD but was still the most brutal thing I've ever seen ... until I finished this DVD!. Smark rating: *1/2; Floyd's rating: ***1/2Then they show Clips of a 6-man brawl with Zandig, Sick Nick and Wifebeater Vs. The Backseay Boys & Justice Pain. And then clips of Zandig Vs. Wifebeater (NoRope-barbed-Wire, I-Quit match - WHICH LOOKED CRAZY)2. Zandig Vs. Wifebeater (I-Quit match - Fans bring the weapons) - Their previous I-Quit match didn't have a finish, so they continue it here. The wrestling ring canvas was taken off and replaced with barbed-wire on the wooden boards. This match is insane. I thought they wouldn't pull out all the stops becasue it was indoors, but I was wrong. Both men refused to quit. I would love to see these 2 guys wrestle a normal match.. Smark rating: ***; Floyd's rating: ****1/23. Sick Nick Mondo Vs. Wifebeater (Tournament of Death 2 Finals, 2002) - A million billion lightbulbs (well 200) are resting against the ring, which is covered in salt! Who will win the 1st ever tournment of death? Smark rating: **; Floyd's rating: ***1/2Pretty good DVD. Wish it was longer, cheaper and had more of a variety of wrestlers. I've heard CZW has some great non-Deathmatch wrestling, so I'll check out Aerial Assault DVD next.. When I was little and I mowed the lawn, I would use the weed wacker on the edge and wondered if it would hurt if it hit me. Now I know.. IT WILL!!!
summary: Really a 4-star DVD, but Zandig made me kick it up a notch or he'd hit me..
Title: N/A

reviewText: Combat Zone Wrestling started out in garages and warehouses. Their bloody violent style got them noticed, but that's it. Without their ultraviolence, CZW wouldn't be on DVD. Since the old days, where Madmanpondo, Nick Mondo,wifebeater,Lobo and so on were diving off balconies, smashing light tubes across each others heads, and exploding barbed wire, they calmed down. They got on TV (but recently kicked off), came out with DVD's and were getting popular. I remember first hearing about them on FOX news because of their ultraviolence and i remember seeing images i will never forget. So i became interested and I am glad CZW is on DVD and actually had shows across the ocean. I had tickets to go to the tournament of death 3, but i couldnt go because of the rain. The show was also outside. They continued anyway from what I understand. But these tournaments of death are EXTREME! HARDCORE! ULTRAVIOLENT!!!  Tournament of Death(the first one) was CRAZY and out of control. But, i advise you to go to smartmarkvideo.com and get some CZW DVD's that are not avaiable on Amazon. Mainly like tournament of death 2 or soon, 3. So, if you are into bloody out of control near death so called wrestling, get this DVD when it comes out. I promise you, it will be so worth it.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is the first annual TOD and its a doozy. Everyone gave there all and it shows in this tournament. Eventhough this was filmed back in 2001 it is still right up there with todays standard of ultraviolence. In this dvd you'll see "Sick" Nick Mondo(now unfortunatly retired) W.B (the beater) Mr Insanity Toby Klien,Hardcore Nick Gage and many more. Some of the matches included are panes of glass, 200 light tubes, fans bring the weapons and even a weedwacker shows up. Some highlights are a assault driver off a removal truck(20 feet) through glass and tables, the 200 light tube match and theres even some good normal no weapons wrestling on here aswell. Ive said it once and Ill say it again CZW is the best indy fed out there today and John Zandig is one of the best promoters out there. If you like any so called wwe "hardcore" match youll love this. This was one of my 1st CZW events I brought and 25 tapes later I still love their events, and after seeing this tape you will too!
summary: An awesome event  from an awesome company
Title: N/A

reviewText: I don't normally write reviews, but after watching this trash, I was COMPELLED to hop on here and spout.First, I didn't expect a whole heck of a lot from CZW.  I've read reviews of the promotion's other DVD releases, as well as reviews from shows put on over the years.  I was familiar with their "ultraviolent" "wrestling" style and certain wrestlers (Sick Nick Mondo has wrestled for a promotion here in St. Paul, MN several times).  For the most part, I knew what I was getting into.  Also, I will preface this by saying I am in fact a fan of ECW, I do not live in a trailor park, and I have all my teeth.It amazes me how many people have given this five stars.  Jerry Lawler once exclaimed that ECW was "violent crap."  If ECW, which at one point touted technical-wrestling geniuses Chris Benoit, Eddy Guerrero, and Dean Malenko, was violent crap, it pales in comparison to the ultraviolent crap CZW puts out.  Not once in this entire DVD was there a move even REMOTELY resembling a wrestling move.  Sick Nick Mondo can at times put on a decent wrestling match, but not once on this DVD was there anything close to wrestling.  Literally, it was grown men hitting each other with light tubes, scraping each other (with the obligatory camera close up detailing each little poke, scrape, and tear of the flesh) with barbed wire, and even whacking each other with weed whackers.  YES, weed whackers.  In fact, the weed whacker may actually be drammatic if Wifebeater (a wrestler named Wifebeater....how clever) wasn't standing at the ropes, flexing his abdomen, while his opponent started the weed whacker, showed it to the audience, and then FINALLY whacked his midsection.As far as I could surmise, CZW does have decent wrestlers as the opening introduction video alluded to.  The clips of guys taking sick bumps from tops of scaffolding, trailors, and even semi trucks onto the concrete, show that CZW can put on exciting matches.  These aren't it.  Even more annoying than the featured matches (of which nearly each involves CZW owner, John Zandig...go figure) are the special features.  3 or 4 extra matches are included, not in their entirety, but as a selection of between 7 and 11 clips of during the match.  I have no doubt that the extra matches are similar to the featured matches (again...nearly ALL including CZW owner John Zandig) but to flip through 10 clips for each match is not only tedious, it is BORING too.The production level of the DVD is surprisingly decent considering the source.  CZW is a 5th-rate promotion out of the East Coast, but the DVD doesn't necessarily reflect that.  Zandig did a decent job producing this, despite my earlier comments about the special features.  Multiple camera angles are offered on the special features clips, which is actually quite refreshing.  Also, the music video montage featuring clips of some serious bumps during the promotion's history was incredible.  It too was very well done, even if the theme music was cheesey ("Breakin' the law....once again.....C...Z...W!!!") and poorly performed.Despite my disgust with this DVD, I will give CZW another chance to "wow" me based solely on the video montage at the beginning of the DVD.  I can only assume that it can only get better....right?
summary: I'm Scarred from watching this garbage
Title: N/A

reviewText: Combat Zone Wrestling or CZW is one of many independent wrestling promotions that rose from the popularity that is the blood-and-guts approach of Extreme Championship Wrestling(ECW. Bloodied foreheads, broken tables, barbed wire, and crowd interaction are trademarks of this particularly brutal style of professional wrestling. However, where ECW excelled with mature storylines and actual wrestling (gasp!), CZW is nothing more than a pretender to the throne. "CZW: Scarred" contains very little wrestling. Rather, we are treated to matches involving men finding creative ways in which to maim and mutilate each other with such props as light tubes and weedwackers (yes, you read that last part right). This is little more than a glorified backyard federation. As a matter of fact, several of these matches were filmed in a backyard.  The sad fact of the matter is CZW actually has some talented wrestlers, but you would not know it from this particular DVD. There is absolutely no psychology or visceral feelings to go along with any of these matches.  Rather, you get the "I-slice-you/you-slice-me" approach that is intended solely for shock value. It's not that I am against hardcore wrestling. To the contrary; Wrestlers like Terry Funk and Mick Foley have successfully utilized blood and other hardcore elements in their matches, but were still able to tell a compelling story in the process. The only story CZW intends to tell is one detailing the importance of having a good education. On the plus side, "CZW: Scarred" is a professionally-produced slick DVD with nice sound and video quality, which is more than I can say for other wrestling DVDs. The DVD clocks in at about 90 minutes with (only) three complete matches and a plethora of highlights and video clips. Hey, if watching grown men slice each other to ribbons is your thing, this is a DVD for you. However, if you want some actual wrestling with hardcore fighting, take a pass.
summary: "Wrestling" is too polite of a term
Title: N/A
